lessons.title: Greetings & Basics
lessons.description: Learn essential Shona greetings

lessons.title: Numbers 1-10
lessons.description: Count from 1 to 10 in Shona

lessons.title: Family Members
lessons.description: Learn words for family members

lessons.title: Vanhu Vemhuri - Family People
lessons.description: Expand family vocabulary and practice family conversations
learningObjectives: Master plural forms of family terms
discoveryElements: Explore traditional family roles and responsibilities
Discover how family relationships shape social interactions
Learn about family gatherings and traditions
culturalNotes: Grandparents hold special wisdom and respect
Family decisions are often made collectively
Children are taught to respect all family members

vocabulary.usage: Word for grandfather, also respectful address for elderly men
Word for grandmother, also respectful address for elderly women

lessons.title: Kushanda neZviito zvamaoko - Work and Physical Actions
Kumusika - At the Market
lessons.description: Learn market vocabulary, colors, and basic negotiation phrases
discoveryElements: Explore traditional Shona markets and their importance
Discover local foods and traditional crafts
Learn about bargaining as a social interaction
culturalNotes: Markets are social centers, not just commercial spaces
Bargaining is expected and shows engagement
Respect for vendors and their goods is important

lessons.title: Mazwi Emutauro - Sounds of Language
lessons.description: Master Shona pronunciation and tone patterns
learningObjectives: Master Shona vowel sounds (a, e, i, o, u)
Practice tone patterns and their meanings
Learn prenasalized consonants (mb, nd, ng, nz)
discoveryElements: Explore the musical nature of Shona language
Discover how tones change word meanings
culturalNotes: Shona is a tonal language with high and low tones
Proper pronunciation shows respect for the language
Each region may have slight pronunciation differences

lessons.title: Kubatanidza neRurimi rwakakwana - Integration and Fluent Conversation
Manzwi Matsvuku - Clear Sounds
lessons.description: Practice consonant clusters and whistled sounds
learningObjectives: Master whistled consonants (sv, zv, tsv, dzv)
Develop muscle memory for difficult sounds
discoveryElements: Explore the unique sound system of Shona
Discover how sounds connect to meaning
Learn about sound symbolism in Shona
culturalNotes: Whistled sounds are unique to Shona and related languages
Practice makes perfect with difficult sounds

lessons.title: Nhamba Dzekutanga - Ordinal Numbers and Time Concepts
Rwiyo Rwemutauro - The Song of Language
lessons.description: Master rhythm, stress, and intonation patterns
learningObjectives: Master natural rhythm and stress patterns
Learn question intonation vs. statement intonation
discoveryElements: Explore how rhythm creates meaning in Shona
Discover the musical qualities of natural speech
Learn about emotional expression through intonation
culturalNotes: Shona has natural rhythm patterns that create beauty
Emotional expression is important in communication
Natural flow shows comfort with the language

vocabulary.usage: Verb meaning to cry or make sound
Verb meaning to hear or feel

lessons.title: Ukurudzi - Mastery and Cultural Application
lessons.description: Acknowledge learning progress in culturally appropriate way
